titleStmt.title: An advantageous method of extricating the nation out of its difficulties. Humbly proposed by Thomas Whately.
titleStmt.author: Whately, Thomas.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T. Milbourn, for the author, and are to be had at Mr. Carter's in Old Palace-yard near the Parliament-house; and at the Plow on the Royal Exchange, up Stairs on the north side,

notesStmt.note: Proposing establishment of market-banks throughout the country for financing the current war.
Manuscript note on outer margin of p. 8: For market-bank 1695.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.

place.placeName: Mr. Carter's in Old Palace-yard near the Parliament-house;
the Plow on the Royal Exchange, up Stairs on the north side
